channel.title: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?
channel.description: After an argument with one of my ex members on my RSPS, he DoSed it, and I just figured out how to get it up again, and he says he stole my source files. Yes he did have Admininstrator Status, but I still do not believe him. I do not believe him because before he DoSed it, I gave my password to his irl friend who was my friend. And I think his friend gave him my password, and did "GiveAdmin" to his account. So is it possible that he has my files? If so, how do I prevent him from making updates to my server? And he also plans on DoSing my server again, any way of possibly defending my server again'st the DoS?

item.title: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:9, topic:442323”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=544958.msg3995051#msg3995051 date=1337142919]
…it’s still stealing.
[/quote]

Stealing implies the deprivation of whatever is being stolen. For example, when somebody steals your pink fuzzy slippers, they are depriving you of them.

I’m not saying it’s right, but it’s really just the unauthorized possession of property.

Also, doing an in-game command should not give anyone access to the machine. Unless he knew the machine password, or you were sharing the source (dropbox, etc) then he can’t have the source.[/quote]
In other words, it would be considered copyright infringement, but in all honesty this is stolen code from Jagex anyways.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?

item.title: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?

@ston3 wrote:

THank you very much zyle.

item.title: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

…it’s still stealing.

Stealing implies the deprivation of whatever is being stolen. For example, when somebody steals your pink fuzzy slippers, they are depriving you of them.

I’m not saying it’s right, but it’s really just the unauthorized possession of property.

Also, doing an in-game command should not give anyone access to the machine. Unless he knew the machine password, or you were sharing the source (dropbox, etc) then he can’t have the source.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?

item.title: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?

item.source: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?

item.title: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Yes.

Although technically it isn’t stealing, because stealing implies the removal of the original copy.

For example, if someone stole your pink fuzzy slippers, then you wouldn’t have them anymore. But if someone copied them, then you’d still have a pair, and they would as well.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?

item.title: Is it possible for someone to steal your files?
item.dc:creator: @JCor9 JCor9
item.description:
@JCor9 wrote:

Alright giving your self admin doesnt give you the files… Only way is if your ran it off a vps and he had access to that… If its your home computer hes lying… Ip ban him, change your pass and their problem solved

Read full topic
